intro: Dendroviguiera sylvatica, commonly known as the forest dendroviguiera, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four or five petals. Dendroviguiera sylvatica is often found in dense undergrowth of tropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
